speaker: HELENA
text_entry: SCENE II. Rousillon. Before the COUNT's palace.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Enter Clown, and PAROLLES, following

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Good Monsieur Lavache, give my Lord Lafeu this

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: letter: I have ere now, sir, been better known to

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: you, when I have held familiarity with fresher

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: clothes; but I am now, sir, muddied in fortune's

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: mood, and smell somewhat strong of her strong

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: displeasure.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Truly, fortune's displeasure is but sluttish, if it

speaker: Clown
text_entry: smell so strongly as thou speakest of: I will

speaker: Clown
text_entry: henceforth eat no fish of fortune's buttering.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Prithee, allow the wind.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Nay, you need not to stop your nose, sir; I spake

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: but by a metaphor.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Indeed, sir, if your metaphor stink, I will stop my

speaker: Clown
text_entry: nose; or against any man's metaphor. Prithee, get

speaker: Clown
text_entry: thee further.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Pray you, sir, deliver me this paper.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Foh! prithee, stand away: a paper from fortune's

speaker: Clown
text_entry: close-stool to give to a nobleman! Look, here he

speaker: Clown
text_entry: comes himself.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Enter LAFEU

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Here is a purr of fortune's, sir, or of fortune's

speaker: Clown
text_entry: cat,--but not a musk-cat,--that has fallen into the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: unclean fishpond of her displeasure, and, as he

speaker: Clown
text_entry: says, is muddied withal: pray you, sir, use the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: carp as you may; for he looks like a poor, decayed,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: ingenious, foolish, rascally knave. I do pity his

speaker: Clown
text_entry: distress in my similes of comfort and leave him to

speaker: Clown
text_entry: your lordship.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: My lord, I am a man whom fortune hath cruelly

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: scratched.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: And what would you have me to do? 'Tis too late to

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: pare her nails now. Wherein have you played the

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: knave with fortune, that she should scratch you, who

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: of herself is a good lady and would not have knaves

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: thrive long under her? There's a quart d'ecu for

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: you: let the justices make you and fortune friends:

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: I am for other business.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: I beseech your honour to hear me one single word.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: You beg a single penny more: come, you shall ha't;

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: save your word.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: My name, my good lord, is Parolles.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: You beg more than 'word,' then. Cox my passion!

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: give me your hand. How does your drum?

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: O my good lord, you were the first that found me!

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Was I, in sooth? and I was the first that lost thee.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: It lies in you, my lord, to bring me in some grace,

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: for you did bring me out.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Out upon thee, knave! dost thou put upon me at once

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: both the office of God and the devil? One brings

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: thee in grace and the other brings thee out.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Trumpets sound

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: The king's coming; I know by his trumpets. Sirrah,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: inquire further after me; I had talk of you last

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: night: though you are a fool and a knave, you shall

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: eat; go to, follow.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: I praise God for you.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Exeunt
